meanings.definition: A series of fine lines or wires in the focus of the eyepiece of an optical instrument, used as a reference point or measuring scale.
meanings.sent1: The reticle in the telescope helped me aim at the stars.
meanings.sent2: She adjusted the reticle in the microscope to focus on the tiny cell.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel mistook the reticle for a spider web and tried to catch it.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a reticle, carefully aligning thoughts like fine lines to make sense of the chaos.
meanings.sent5: The reticle in his camera lens made capturing the perfect shot much easier.
